page.title: 11WHITENER'S FARM
page.content: { The farmer who owns this farm has {lived here for 65 years. He farms 82 {acres, 40 of which he owns.}The rest he rents from a near-by estate.{He {uses most of this land for grazing and {pasture. He also grows fodder crops eg.{barley and grass (for silage). He {keeps 28 dairy cattle and 16 beef {cattle.}The number of cattle he keeps changes, depending on the time of year. {He has no employed helpers and {manages the farm,with his sister's {help. When they are ready, the beef cattle are taken to{Oswestry market}to be sold. Any milk produced goes to {Ellesmere Dairy to}be made into butter,cream etc.{The amount of milk {produced is approximately 130 gallons {per day. }By Sandra Lowe Alison Hughes Nerys Webster
